translation1: "All Bosch electric tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools undergo careful inspection, testing, and are subject to the strict controls of the Bosch quality assurance. Bosch therefore provides a warranty for Bosch electric tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. The customer's warranty claims arising from the purchase contract with the seller, as well as legal rights, are not restricted by this warranty.We provide warranty for these tools according to the following conditions: We provide warranty in accordance with the following rules (numbers 2-7) by free correction of defects in the tool that are proven to be due to a material or manufacturing fault within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, for commercial or professional use or equivalent demand 12 months.The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first buyer. The decisive factor is the date on the original purchase invoice. For all commercial, blue electrical tools and measuring tools (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial screwdrivers and pneumatic tools) the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers these tools within 4 weeks of the purchase date.This extended warranty does not cover Accu-Packs, charging equipment, and any accompanying accessories. Registration can only be done online at www.bosch-pt.com/warranty. As confirmation, the registration receipt, which must be printed immediately, and the original purchase receipt, from which the purchase date can be determined, are required.Registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of the data to be entered there. Excluded from the guarantee are: parts that are subject to wear and tear due to normal use or other natural causes, as well as defects in the tool that can be traced back to normal use, anomalous environmental conditions, foreign operating conditions, overloading or inadequate maintenance or care. Defects in the tool that were caused by the use of non-Bosch original accessories, add-ons or replacement parts.Tools, on which changes or additions have been made. Small deviations from the specified quality, which are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The correction of the defect, which we recognize as our guarantee obligation, is carried out in the manner that we, at our discretion, repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a fault-free tool (if necessary, also with a successor model).Replaced tools or parts become our property."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is mostly fluent with minor errors which do not impede understanding. The use of 'accu-packs' might be better replaced with 'battery packs' for a more common terminology. And, 'Small deviations from the specified quality...' sentence structure could be improved for more clarity. Overall, language use aligns with standard English, but minor improvements needed." } }

translation1: "Tire selection for racing bikes - really that secure? I woke up full of action this morning because I wanted to do some training for my bike tour next week, at least a little. Said, done, and I rode my racing bike, which I bought on eBay yesterday.The first 40km were really beautiful - but then happened what always waits in every city (this time: thank you Krefeld!) Glass shards on the track. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire didn't want to go any further on the rest of the track.Since I didn't have the opportunity to get a replacement jacket and hose on account of the day of the week, I had to turn back with a bad mood and take the first road home. It wasn't that bad weather-wise, maybe it's even better if I practice with the tire change before the bike tour. Now I'm facing a question and I hope you can help me.Since I had to cover a long distance over several days, I didn't want to encounter this problem often. Now it wasn't too bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who picked up the bike for me at 14:00 and had traveled 120 km on them!) and he considered them suboptimal because he had been riding them for several years. If I think about it, I need to change the tire after 80-90 km, then I'm really not in a good mood :DI recently spoke with an older man at the train station who asked me why I wasn't using Marathon Plus tires; they are supposed to be unbreakable. Now it all sounds so tempting. But are they really that unbreakable?I don't feel like spending 40 euros on tires now, only to be disappointed. Furthermore, I wonder: I believe I have 25x622 in my mind right now. There are indeed such tires (apparently?) for marathon plus tires, but the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you recommend a different tire for a racing bike to me? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! Would you rather recommend the Durano DD?Thank you again in advance for your help and loving greetings!"

Despite these, the overall context and narrative are easy to follow and understand." } }

translation1: "\"The party we wanted to throw\": Frankfurt celebrates after a successful comeback against Leverkusen. After 22 minutes, the Hessians, who had lost their last two games in a row, seemed to be on their way to the next Bundesliga crisis.But then the SGE turned on, shot itself within a good hour with frustration over a weak start to the season, and won furiously with 5:2. \"It's insane what the boys did today,\" trainer Oliver Glasner jubilated on DAZN and praised each individual who was there with a \"general applause\". At first, it looked like another dampener for the now ninth-placed Frankfurt, who were still behind their expectations, with Patrik Schick leading Leverkusen 2:0.What happened then also impressed the SGE trainer. \"How the players then returned and showed a fantastic performance,\" said Glasner further. I am absolutely crazy happy with the performance we showed and of course also with the result.Also defender Christopher Lenz, who was able to play again for the first time since the fourth game day and his overcome muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I believe our mental strength is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old and was particularly happy with the result for the spectators. That was the party we wanted to celebrate today.For the upcoming tasks, Glassner now wants to focus on himself, as he feels well prepared in terms of the personnel situation. It is remarkable that we have all players fit in December, that all players are physically in top condition. It is top-notch work in our medical department, but also the players live professionally.Now we want to \"go step by step and remain modest\" and complete the tasks at this level by the end of the year. As the next step, there is already a foreign game scheduled for Borussia Mönchengladbach on Wednesday as part of the English week (18.30, Sky)."

translation1: "We have had a new fiber optic connection in the house for a few weeks now. Unfortunately, I am now having problems setting up a stable WiFi network.Previously, I had a DSL 50 Mbit connection and used Devolo DLan, which received and transmitted 50 Mbit without any issues, except for a few failures. The new fiber optic connection sends 500 Mbit to the FritzBox 7590 and the DLan module connected to it also receives these speeds. However, on the other DLan module, which transmits WiFi, the full 500 Mbit is no longer received, but the further away from the module I am in the house, the less that is received (for example, using a power socket that is 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module).This leads to the fact that the internet with the new fiber optic connection is now slower on the first floor (~45 Mbit) than before. I also ordered a new Devolo Magic Set, which apparently uses new technology. This was slightly better than DLan, but there were also similar large losses here.Could someone explain why so much internet speed is lost when using glass fiber through the power line? And is LAN really the only solution? It would be extremely expensive to lay LAN cables in the house.I am really frustrated as to why I created an extra account here. Therefore, I would be even more happy to receive an answer."

translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, leading to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuit, which perfectly reproduces the behavior of a vacuum tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we present a brand new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amplifier circuits, the VTX amplifiers are waiting with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.These amps also contain the multistage Valvetronix vacuum tube preamplifier. This is based on real analog circuits because these can better capture the sound variations and nuances of a vacuum tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system, from which the natural resonances only sputter.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can correct and exaggerate historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound exactly like you've always imagined. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is mainly due to the 2001 introduction of the VOX Valve Reactor-Technology. Since then, it has been continuously improved to meet new sound requirements, which led to a performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 with more dynamics and significantly improved amplifier models.The new VT+ Valvetronix series from VOX offers a range of options from the handheld VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, providing guitarists with a wide variety of sound options. All guitarists dream of the pressure and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and quick response. During an incoming analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the end stage determines the character of the amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor Technology based on this finding.The valve reactor circuit of a VT+- amplifier, which is equipped with a 12AX7 vacuum tube, perfectly captures the subtle nuances and sound character of a vacuum tube amplifier."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is highly technical and very fluent in its explanations and details about the Valvetronix series and other related technologies. This sentence has an awkward phrasing where 'waiting with an authenticity' does not come across as natural. Additionally, the phrase 'resonances only sputter' doesn't quite make sense in English and would benefit from being revised for clarity." } }

translation1: "Bundesbauministerin Klara Geywitz: Expropriation does not create new housing The new Federal Minister for Housing, Klara Geywitz (SPD), has spoken out against the expropriation of large housing corporations, as has been proposed in a popular vote in Berlin. \"With expropriation, no new housing units are created, only the ownership structure changes,\" said Geywitz in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to ensure that tenants have security so that their rent remains affordable in the next few years. A diverse mix of, for example, private landlords, cooperatives or housing associations is actually the best protection against monopoly formation. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens and Left Party wants to set up an expert commission on how to deal with the result of the rental referendum.If the situation does not calm down, Geywitz held talks with the FDP in the coalition government about further strengthening the rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rental price brake until 2029, a limitation on rent increases in tense housing markets, and the expansion of the rental index. I will speak with the Justice Minister to implement it as quickly as possible.If the rental market does not relax, \"we will talk with our coalition partners about further steps,\" emphasized the SPD politician."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The linguistic structure and grammar of the text are solid, and there are no obvious syntax mistakes or unnatural wording in English. translation1: "\"Why children are not tyrants\" Document, ARD Mediathek CW psychological violence, sexual abuse, power abuse The ARD documentary has appeared in my Twitter timeline today, and I have watched it immediately.Michael Winterhoff, a child psychologist, is often seen as a guest in talk shows and gives lectures throughout Europe. His book \"Why Our Children Become Tyrants\" (2008) caused a heated debate about education. Now, former patients and education officials are raising serious accusations against him.Please be careful, the film is hard to endure. And I am very grateful that many people now think and act differently. Our parents and other responsible people should never, never, never seek power over the child.Our goal must always be to give the child space for their development and to enlarge the framework for the child as much as possible in the given situation. Brrr, I am still shivering."

translation1: "I am frustrated with Sky Sport F1. Hello F1 fans, throughout the season, the quality on German Sky has been decreasing, so I wanted to take a break from this post. First of all, today, during the F2 race, the transmission was interrupted to start the F1 pre-race show on time.Although the delayed start and the accident at the beginning of the time plan were far behind the planning, it was still possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision. It seems, however, that due to legal reasons the F1 priority is enjoyed and therefore everything else has to be restricted, so that Sky DE here had no choice. Stupid, especially since Sky UK has broadcasted the end of the race.Despite a small praise: commentator Olivier Zwartyes has handled the difficult situation around the serious accident well. Then there was again a rule violation by the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, so both did not know that under a red flag the tires could be changed. Although this situation occurred in Imola, Baku and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen could change the tires when they received corresponding radio messages from Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators knew immediately that there was a possibility of deviation. In my opinion, such fundamental rules should be known when commenting on F1 at a Pay-TV channel. It's also not the first time they've had to guess what's allowed or required by the rules, both of them have constant uncertainties in the topic of rules.Generally, I don't like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I have to admit that it's a matter of taste. But honestly, I prefer Heiko Wasser from RTL even more. There are constant stupidities that both of them do, which make them look unprofessional, like ordering coffee from the (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The last one brings a lot of chaos to the comments, which he apparently doesn't take seriously. Last but not least, advertising takes over at Sky, in the final round Sky is the only broadcaster that goes into advertising, as we can hear at F1TV, where only the German audio track without commentary comes directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do that.These two channels make less advertising during training than Sky, and that as a free-TV channel. Although we have to praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, that alone does not make me overlook the disadvantages. The rest of the program of Sky Sport F1 is also very poor and full of repetitions.Overall, Sky is really the worst German-speaking channel that broadcasts F1. Ironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they still broadcast, except for advertising. So at least the grandiose F1 season makes less fun than it would with a reasonable broadcaster.I would like to hear your opinion once."

translation1: "Rotinger brake pads are designed for the demands of the dynamic driver, who values reliability and safety when braking even under difficult conditions. Rotinger brake pads are cast and then mechanically processed (machined and cut). All tested pads are manufactured in short series according to individual technical properties that are specific to certain pads and patterns.Based on the individual technical drawing, a special production program is created which focuses on the growth of the disc according to the properties of the original mounting. The resulting tested discs ensure high comfort and braking effectiveness. Additionally created openings increase the cooling effectiveness of the disc, while the cuts improve the cleaning of the brake pads and rotors.The aesthetic properties of our painted sheets highlight the character of each car through an attractive and striking appearance."

"Basketball-Bundesliga: Derby-Debakel of MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against the Merlins Crailsheim At least youngster Johannes Patrick was absent. Again nothing: For the second time in less than three months, the Riesen lost in Crailsheim - and how!Before the game, John Patrick, the trainer of Ludwigsburg, looked back on the cup loss in early October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim and said: \"We still have something anger in our stomach.\" However, this anger did not subside after the game - on the contrary, it increased even more due to the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Bundesliga basketball. Moreover, the way of appearance was even more disappointing than the naked result.A statistic can be called to represent the entire dilemma: The three-quote was only 13%, with 4 hits (all from young Johannes Patrick) out of 31 attempts - are there any more questions? The answer from John Patrick: \"We were not concentrated enough after the win in Tenerife and did not manage to implement what we had trained.\" Specifically, moving the ball.Sebastian Gleim's opponent reacted differently: \"Winning the game for the second time against Ludwigsburg is a great game,\" said the happy coach. \"It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people.\" Although only 750 spectators were allowed in the Hohenlohe-Arena on Saturday, they were worth their money.Last but not least, thanks to BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led his team. \"The best point guard I've ever trained,\" praised Gleim. Meanwhile, in Patrick's team, the players like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) failed to perform throughout the game.Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the giants prevent a total debacle and come within eight points, after they had already fallen behind 39:59. Besides Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon also contributed twelve points. Fortunately, there is still a lot of time left for squabbling.The Riesen received the Skyliners Frankfurt on Wednesday (8 pm), with a maximum of 750 spectators in Ludwigsburg beforehand."

translation1: "I generally believe that it is not fair to ask children to take on the role of parents for their younger siblings. However, I think it is good for older siblings to help take care of the younger ones to some extent. They can keep an eye on them, help them out, bring them a drink, etc.They learn responsibility by helping in the family and being involved. As long as they are still young enough to be children, I see no problem. If your K1 can handle it alone for a short time and it's okay for him, then that's good too.You can best determine if it is suitable for your children. It is not the case that he should wrap K2 and accompany him for hours during sleep. From a legal standpoint, it is probably questionable.Perhaps the psychologist's statement also comes from there. If something were to happen like a fire, burglary, earthquake, alien invasion, etc., it would indeed be too much responsibility for K1 to take care of K2. Whether this is a risk you want to take is of course up to you ;)"

translation1: "The 110-kV power cable will be built in 2022. The approval for the laying of the new high-voltage cable in Tann is legally valid. The decision of the government of Lower Bavaria paves the way for the construction, which will begin in 2022.The network operator Bayernwerk is now sharing this seven-kilometer long cable. The cable will connect the substation Tann in the north of the community and the existing 110-kilovolt power line between Simbach and Pfarrkirchen. The cable will be connected to a mast of the overhead power line near the village of Edermanning in Reut."
"It works. Thank you so much for your help. Wish you all a beautiful evening."

"Heavy \"Butcher\"-Question: What is a \"Butcher\" in Amberg? This dialect word, sent from Amberg, has caused hefty reflection in the BR-TV program \"Wir in Bayern\".However, unlike many preceding days, the concept remained unrecognized by the callers this time. No, there was no \"nervous person\" or \"someone who has to go fast\".The people heard from the TV moderator that it was completely false. What the man from Amberg announced and probably also caused astonishment among many people in Upper Palatinate. \"The butcher\", the viewers learned, \"is a piece of paper with which someone wipes the oven.\"Dialect researcher Antony Rowley, who has been interviewed by Bayerischen Fernsehen for years as an expert, confirmed this. With the note that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, somehow derived from the better-known Mundart word \"Houdern\". This closed the education gap - probably also for many who have been living in the Amberg region for a long time."

translation1: "Friedrich Nolte wins the 60th World Cup - Nolte wins in the two-man bobsleigh - Sports The mark of the Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 successes is the goal of the bobsleigh pilot. \"I had calculated it once, I had to win nine and a half victories per season, then I could make it to Cortina 2026,\" said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who won two victories in two days at the races in Winterberg.He first defended against Johannes Lochner's attack on Saturday by moving from third place to first place, a difference of 5 hundredths of a second. Then he made some changes to the material setup and on Sunday he increased his lead by 0.30 seconds. With his team Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg) and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he overtook the British Brad Hall.The third place went to the Austrian Benjamin Maier. \"We took a bigger risk today and were rewarded,\" said Friedrich, who also achieved his 22nd consecutive win. The Berchtesgadener Johannes Lochner, who was traveling for Stuttgart, came in fifth place this time after being in second place previously.Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach finished in 4th place in the first race and ended up in 8th place. \"If I knew what he was doing differently, I would do it that way too,\" said Lochner. Nolte won at home - Jamanka on the podium.At her home track, Laura Nolte won her third season's victory in the women's two-man bobsleigh on Sunday. On Saturday, she had to settle for fourth place in the monobob. On Sunday, she raced to victory in the women's three-man bobsleigh with Anschieberin Deborah Levi, as part of a German sweep. Mariama Jamanka, the two-woman bobsleigh Olympic champion from BRC Thüringen, finished in second place with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen.She booked the first podium spot alongside her Olympic qualification this winter. The Wiesbadenerin Kim Kalicki landed with Leonie Fiebig on third place. For me, it was super cool, the first podium spot in the World Cup, I am super happy that Mariama takes me with her.I am very happy with the development. There is still a lot of potential at the beginning, but the start times today were okay,\" said Burghardt and emphasized: \"It's not just about pushing forward, but there's also a lot to do around it.\" Jamanka was a bit annoyed by the not entirely error-free rides, but she said: \"It's going in the right direction.\""
